title: Masala Omelette
steps: Crack 2 large eggs into a bowl and whisk with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper until frothy.
Finely chop 2 tablespoons onion, 1 tablespoon tomato and 1 small green chili.
Heat 1 teaspoon oil in a nonstick pan over medium heat and sauté the chopped onion, tomato and chili for 1–2 minutes until softened.
Pour the beaten eggs into the pan, spread evenly and cook on medium-low for 2–3 minutes until mostly set, then fold or flip and cook 30 seconds more.
Remove from heat and garnish with 1 tablespoon chopped coriander before serving.

title: Veg Pulao
steps: Rinse 1 cup basmati rice until water runs clear and soak for 15 minutes, then drain.
Heat 1 tablespoon ghee in a heavy pan over medium heat and add 1 teaspoon jeera, letting it sputter for a few seconds.
Add 1 medium sliced onion and sauté until golden brown, about 4–5 minutes.
Add 1/4 cup diced carrot, 1/4 cup peas and 1/4 cup chopped beans and cook for 2–3 minutes.
Stir in 1/2 teaspoon garam masala and 1/2 teaspoon salt, then add the drained rice and 2 cups water.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover and cook 10–12 minutes until rice is tender and water is absorbed, then fluff gently with a fork.

title: Tomato Basil Pasta
steps: Bring 1.5 liters of water to a boil, add 1 teaspoon salt and 150 grams (about 1.5 cups) pasta and cook for 8–10 minutes until al dente, then drain and reserve 2 tablespoons pasta water.
Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and sauté 2 minced garlic cloves for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add 2 medium chopped tomatoes or 1 cup tomato puree and simmer for 4–5 minutes until slightly reduced.
Stir in 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil and 1/4 teaspoon salt, then add the drained pasta and 1–2 tablespoons reserved pasta water and toss to coat.
Cook together 1 more minute to marry flavors and serve topped with extra basil if desired.

title: Grilled Paneer Tikka
steps: Cut 200 grams paneer into 1.5 cm cubes and chop 1 small capsicum and 1 small onion into similar-sized pieces.
In a bowl combine 4 tablespoons plain yogurt, 1 teaspoon salt and 1.5 teaspoons mixed spices (tikka masala or a blend of coriander, cumin and chili) to make the marinade.
Toss the paneer, capsicum and onion in the marinade until evenly coated and let rest for 10–15 minutes.
Thread paneer and veggies onto skewers alternating pieces and grill on a hot grill pan or oven at 200°C for 8–10 minutes, turning once, until edges are charred.
Serve hot with mint chutney and lemon wedges.

title: Chickpea Salad Bowl
steps: Drain and rinse 1 can (about 240 g drained) chickpeas or use 1.5 cups cooked chickpeas and place in a mixing bowl.
Dice 1 small cucumber, 1 medium tomato and 1/4 cup red onion and add to the chickpeas.
Whisk together 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 tablespoon lemon juice and 1/2 teaspoon salt and pour over the salad.
Toss gently until everything is evenly coated and chill for 5–10 minutes if desired before serving.

title: Chicken Stir-fry
steps: Slice 300 grams boneless chicken into thin strips and season with 1/4 teaspoon salt.
Heat 1.5 tablespoons oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat and add 2 minced garlic cloves and 1 teaspoon grated ginger for 20–30 seconds.
Add the chicken and stir-fry on high for 4–5 minutes until browned and cooked through.
Add 1 medium sliced onion and 1 small sliced capsicum and stir-fry for 2 minutes until vegetables are crisp-tender.
Pour in 2 tablespoons soy sauce and cook another 1–2 minutes until sauce coats the ingredients, then serve immediately with rice or noodles.

title: Mushroom Fried Rice
steps: Use 2 cups cooked, cooled rice (about 300 g) for best texture and set aside.
Slice 200 grams mushrooms and chop 2 spring onions separating white and green parts.
Heat 1.5 tablespoons oil in a wide pan or wok on high and sauté the mushroom slices until they release moisture and become golden, about 4–5 minutes.
Add the white parts of the spring onion and stir-fry 30 seconds, then add the cooked rice and 1.5 tablespoons soy sauce and toss thoroughly.
Stir-fry for 2–3 minutes until rice is heated through, add the green spring onion tops, adjust 1/2 teaspoon salt if needed and serve hot.

title: Veg Sandwich
steps: Take 2 slices of bread and lightly spread 1 teaspoon butter and 1 teaspoon chutney on each slice.
Thinly slice 2–3 slices of tomato, 4–5 slices of cucumber and a few rings of onion.
Layer the tomato, cucumber and onion on one bread slice, sprinkle 1/8 teaspoon salt evenly and close with the second slice of bread.
Toast in a sandwich press or on a hot pan for 2–3 minutes per side until golden, then cut and serve immediately.

title: Bhindi Sabji
steps: Wash and pat dry 250 grams bhindi (okra) and slice into 1 cm pieces to avoid stickiness.
Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a pan and add 1 medium chopped onion, sauté until translucent for 3–4 minutes.
Add the sliced bhindi and 1 medium chopped tomato along with 1/2 teaspoon turmeric, 1/2 teaspoon chili powder and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
Cook on low to medium heat stirring occasionally for 8–10 minutes until bhindi is tender and not slimy, then serve hot.

title: Schezwan Chicken Wings
steps: Pat dry 500 grams chicken wings and place in a bowl.
Marinate with 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 2 tablespoons schezwan sauce, 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1 minced garlic clove for 10 minutes.
Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a pan and shallow fry or bake the wings at 200°C for 15–20 minutes until golden and cooked through, turning once.
Toss the cooked wings in an additional 1 tablespoon schezwan sauce with 1 minced garlic clove in a hot pan for 1–2 minutes to glaze, then serve hot.

title: Dal Tadka
steps: Rinse 1 cup toor dal well and pressure cook with 3 cups water, 1/2 teaspoon turmeric and a pinch of salt until soft (about 3–4 whistles) or simmer until tender.
Mash the cooked dal lightly and adjust consistency by adding water to about 2 cups of dal mixture and keep warm.
Heat 2–3 tablespoons oil in a small pan, add 1 teaspoon jeera and let it crackle, then add 1 medium finely chopped onion and sauté until golden.
Add 2 crushed garlic cloves and 1 chopped tomato; cook until tomato softens and oil separates, sprinkle 1/4–1/2 teaspoon red chili or green chili to taste.
Pour this hot tadka into the dal, stir well, simmer for 3–5 minutes to blend flavors, then serve garnished with chopped coriander.

title: Curd Rice
steps: Cook 1 cup rice until very soft and let it cool slightly, then mash lightly with a spoon.
Mix the mashed rice with 3/4 cup plain curd and 2 tablespoons milk and season with 1/2 teaspoon salt.
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a small pan, add 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds and let them pop, then add 1/2 teaspoon chopped ginger and 6–7 curry leaves and sauté briefly.
Pour the tempering over the curd rice and mix gently, then serve chilled or at room temperature.

title: Rava Dosa
steps: In a bowl mix 1 cup rava (semolina), 1/4 cup rice flour and 2 tablespoons maida with 1/2 teaspoon cumin, 1/4 teaspoon crushed pepper and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
Gradually add 1 to 1.25 cups water while stirring to form a thin, pourable batter and rest for 15–20 minutes.
Heat a well-seasoned tawa on medium-high heat, pour a ladle of batter in a circular motion to create a thin lacy dosa and drizzle 1 teaspoon oil around edges.
Cook until edges are crisp and underside golden, then lift and serve immediately with chutney or sambar.

title: Aloo Paratha
steps: Knead 1 cup wheat flour with a pinch of salt and 1 tablespoon oil to a soft dough and rest 10 minutes.
Boil and mash 2 medium potatoes and mix with 2 tablespoons finely chopped onion, 1/2 teaspoon cumin, 1/2 teaspoon garam masala and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
Divide dough into two balls, stuff each with half the potato mixture, roll gently into 6–7 inch parathas dusting with flour as needed.
Cook on a hot tawa with 1 teaspoon ghee per side until golden brown and crisp, then serve hot with yogurt or pickle.

title: Fish Curry
steps: Marinate 400 grams fish pieces with 1/4 teaspoon turmeric and 1/4 teaspoon salt and set aside for 5–10 minutes.
Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a pan, sauté 1 medium chopped onion until soft, then add 1 chopped tomato and cook until oil separates.
Add 1/2 teaspoon turmeric, 1/2 teaspoon chili powder and 2 tablespoons tamarind extract (adjust to taste) and 1 cup water to make the curry base.
Add the marinated fish pieces, simmer gently for 8–10 minutes until fish is cooked through, then adjust salt and serve with rice.

title: Sambar
steps: Rinse 1 cup toor dal and pressure cook with 3 cups water until soft, then mash and keep warm.
Soak a small lemon-sized ball of tamarind in 1 cup warm water and extract the pulp to yield about 1/2 cup tamarind water.
Boil the tamarind water with 1 cup mixed vegetables (for example 100 g drumstick pieces and 1 chopped onion) and 1 chopped tomato along with 1–1.5 tablespoons sambar powder and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
Add the cooked dal to the boiling tamarind-vegetable mix and simmer for 8–10 minutes to blend flavors.
Tempering is optional: heat 1 tablespoon oil, add 1/2 teaspoon mustard seeds and curry leaves until they sputter, then pour over sambar before serving.

title: Idli
steps: Grease idli moulds lightly with oil or ghee.
Pour batter to fill each mould about three-quarters full, using about 1 cup batter for a small tray depending on mould size.
Steam in an idli steamer or pressure cooker (without weight) for 10–12 minutes on high heat until a toothpick comes out clean.
Let cool slightly, demould carefully and serve hot with chutney and sambar.

title: Pancakes
steps: In a bowl combine 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 tablespoon sugar, 1 teaspoon baking powder and a pinch of salt.
Whisk in 3/4 cup milk, 1 large egg and 2 tablespoons melted butter until smooth to make batter.
Heat a nonstick pan over medium heat and pour 1/4 cup batter per pancake; cook until bubbles form on top, about 1–2 minutes.
Flip and cook the other side for 1 minute until golden then stack and serve with syrup or toppings.

title: Avocado Toast
steps: Toast 1 slice of bread until crisp to your preference.
Mash half a ripe avocado with 1 teaspoon lemon juice and 1/8 teaspoon salt until slightly chunky.
Spread the avocado mixture evenly over the toast and sprinkle a pinch of chili flakes on top.
Serve immediately to retain the crispness of the bread.

title: Egg Fried Rice
steps: Use 2 cups cooked, chilled rice for best results and separate any clumps with a fork.
Beat 2 large eggs with a pinch of salt and scramble in 1 teaspoon oil in a hot pan, then remove and set aside.
Heat 1 tablespoon oil, sauté 2 chopped spring onion whites for 30 seconds, then add the rice and stir-fry on high for 1–2 minutes.
Add the scrambled eggs back in, pour 1.5 tablespoons soy sauce, toss thoroughly and garnish with spring onion greens before serving.

title: Tuna Salad
steps: Drain one 120 g can of tuna and flake into a bowl.
Chop 1 cup lettuce, 1/4 cucumber and 2 tablespoons onion and add to the bowl with the tuna.
Whisk 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 tablespoon lemon juice and 1/4 teaspoon salt and pour over the salad.
Toss gently to combine and serve chilled.

title: Palak Paneer
steps: Blanch 200 grams spinach in boiling water for 1 minute, then immediately transfer to cold water and blend into a smooth puree.
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a pan and sauté 1 small chopped onion and 2 minced garlic cloves until translucent.
Add 1 chopped tomato, 1/4 teaspoon turmeric and 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander and cook until tomato softens.
Add the spinach puree and simmer for 4–5 minutes, then stir in 150 grams paneer cubes and simmer 2 minutes to warm through before serving.

title: Veg Biryani
steps: Rinse 1.5 cups basmati rice and cook until 80% done in salted boiling water, then drain and set aside.
Heat 2 tablespoons ghee in a heavy pan and fry 1 large thinly sliced onion until deep golden brown, remove half for garnish.
Sauté 1.5 cups mixed vegetables (carrot, peas, beans) with 1 tablespoon biryani masala and 1/2 teaspoon salt for 3–4 minutes.
Layer the partially cooked rice over the vegetable mixture, drizzle 1 tablespoon ghee and cover tightly; cook on low heat for 10–12 minutes to finish steaming.
Fluff gently to mix and garnish with the reserved fried onions before serving.
